content.name: Chrisanthi K
content.review_content: The hotel is very conveniently placed in the city center. The breakfast had a great variety of local and international selections. The pool area is a must see. Our room was very spacious and had great views of the Saigon city. One small inconvenience was that there wasn't enough shelving space to accommodate our shampoo and conditioner containers inside the shower cubicle.

content.name: Daniel Yeo
content.review_content: Comfortable and large hotel with a beautiful infinity pool on the top floor.  Breakfast had variety but more towards local or Asian food.  Room and bed was comfortable but some may feel the bed is hard but I thought it was to my liking. Only gripe with the room is my room was kinda warm and not ventilating well and the layout is a bit different. Did not manage to figure out how the aircon setting works. But kudos that the hotel managed to fit a bathtub in the bathroom.  Final comment was due to the number of rooms and floors they only had 4 lifts so May have to wait a while to use it.  Service was great and the staff were warm and welcoming.  Hotelsâ€™ guests are primary tourists.

content.name: Journey40111809949
content.review_title: The hotel staff asks guests to write 5 star reviews during dinner
content.review_content: give this hotel 3 stars. Rooms and location is great. Would have given 5 stars but a few strange things happened during meals. During breakfast, our full plates of food kept getting taken and thrown away from our table when we hadnâ€™t even sat down to eat yet- because exploring the buffet and getting things gradually, like fruit and coffee, then hot food. Staff just do not have patience. Went to the bar for drinks at night and could only sit in a small section due to a corporate event. The pool closed early for a wedding the first day. I felt as though guests were treated second to outside events. We tried the seafood buffet and it was not very good, rubbery. I was interrupted in the middle of my meal when my husband walked away, a server begging me to leave a 5 star review on

content.name: kazbags2000
content.review_content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our arrival into  vietnam.  Our room was quite small with just enough room for our luggage and twin beds. We had a balcony overlooking the busy street - located in district 3. The hotel buffet breakfast was great with amazing city views from the restaurant. The best part of the hotel was the rooftop infinity pool overlooking saigon - stunning by day and night

content.name: Maria Furmetz
content.review_title: An amazing experience at the top of Saigon
content.review_content: Came to the hotel for a day-pass access to the pool. I canâ€™t describe how beautiful and amazing the pool was! Staff were very friendly and helpful since we put our first step to the lobby. I met one guy whose name was Tuan in a yellow top, he was very friendly and supportive in giving us details about the hotel and advices about the area! Weâ€™ll definitely come back to the hotel to have a stay here when we have a chance! Thank you La Vela!

content.name: 834jen
content.review_content: The most amazing stay. The hotel is gorgeous, beds and pillows are soo comfy. We had amazing sleeps with the air conditioning and dark rooms making it very comfortable. The rooftop area with the e infinity pool and the gym were frequently visited by us. Amazing breakfast buffet and staff were all so lovely. We came here as a family (parents and 2 adult couples and a single) and it was fantastic. Would highly recommend. Wish the lifts were a little quicker though!

content.name: Emily
content.review_content: Fantastic hotel! Very clean with the comfiest beds and pillows. Rooms are spacious with enough free space to put your luggage. The view from the infinity pool is the best!   The only complaint I have is the elevators - very slow and inefficient system with only 3 working elevators that all go in the same direction (up OR down, all at once). If you're in your room and want to go down to level 1, it goes all the way up to the rooftop and only picks you up on the way down :(

content.name: John Marston

content.review_content: What a lovely hotel for my vacations. Although I was a bit tired after a long flight so I didnâ€™t have much chance to communicate with the staffs. I would recommend this lovely Hotel for everyone and just be careful with the bad feedback on this. Not all of them are true and reasonable. Just enjoy and tell the staffs things you might need, they are always willing to help you out.

content.name: Clementine V
content.review_title: Rooftop bar and pool sets this apart from the others
content.review_content: Come for the rooftop bar, live music, and infinity pool! But don't get too comfortable as the rooms could use some extra cleaning. Spotted some black mold in the shower (see photo), and now I can't Unsee it. check in process was harder than it should've been. Elevators take a lifetime to get to you. Rooms are a bit cramped but definitely modern. Clean for the most part except said shower. And so far , the service has been good but definitely not the best we've had in HCMC. With all the other great options around the area , I would likely not come back except to grab a drink and swim on their rooftop.

content.name: Judy Huynh
content.review_title: Cozy and warm place. Good service and respect the guests
content.review_content: This is our second stay at La Vela Saigon. I come here to visit my hometown for Tet. I love the atmosphere here, it's cozy and warm. Because the staff and service is wonderful, I cancelled plan to stay elsewhere and return to enjoy fabulous  impression of this top class hotel. Facilities are impressive, and all staff reception, housekeeping, restaurant staff were helpful and accommodating. Particular mention should go to Ms. Han (with yellow Ao dai), who made sure that we had been helped whenever we needed it. She's so nice and caring when she greets the guests with a beautiful smile and a drink. I used to stay in many luxury hotels to small hotels, this is the most kind and professional one. They respect all the guests even who you are, where you from, and how you look like

content.name: Sarah
content.review_content: Amazing view from the rooftop pool, beautiful luxurious rooms. Big breakfast with lots of choices. During New Year cute activity. Only downside for me personally was the bed being to hard as I have back injury and am really light weight. But for most people the beds will be very comfortable.

content.name: Ricardo D
content.review_content: Super beautiful hotel nice bed and good service very beautiful skybar and infinite pool at the top of the hotel also super nice views from the top you can see all the big buildings sometimes some fireworks the infinite pool is super nice with hot weather

content.name: Mey S
content.review_content: Good time with the friends. The hotel was very nice and clean and everyone helped us do what we can to make our stay as nice as possible. The service was really nice. The employees at the front desk were wonderful

content.name: Anthony Chen S
content.review_content: Very nice place to visit o your vacation and in the future we will referral to friends and family  This will be our next trip to visit with family. This is our first experience here in Vietnam and so far we love the nite life

content.name: Cheo S
content.review_content: Visiting Saigon and checking out labels hotel. Hotel is a wonderful place to visit. Would definitely recommend it to anyone. Hi chi mieh is a beautiful place to be. Canâ€™t wait to explore Vietnam.  Beautiful.

content.name: Alex Brooks
content.review_title: A short visit to La Vela
content.review_content: We just came here to visit our friends, but were totally amazed by the spacious and elegant lobby! The hotel is filled with Lunar New Year spirit, as well as outstanding staff! Thank you Sam and Tuan for spending times with us, these two are so lovely, they also gave us free traditional lucky letters as a gift! Defintely will stay at this hotel if we have a chance.

content.name: Linh H
content.review_title: One of the best hotels in Vietnam!
content.review_content: The rooms here are really nice, clean and the staff were wonderful! The best part of the hotel was the pool. It overlooks the city of Saigon and when you swim during sunset, the view is even more incredible!   I love how the staff is attentive and always help me with my bags and any problems that I need.   I would definitely stay here again next time I am in Vietnam!

content.name: Andrea C
content.review_content: A super nice, luxurious hotel in the middle of Saigon. Free breakfast and also a lovely infinity pool on the top of the hotel as well. The bedding is very comfortable and the showers are nice too. Wifi can be spotty at times but it really depends on where the room is. Would stay here again!

content.name: kartik khandelwal
content.review_title: Great Experiences! Nice Amenities and food
content.review_content: The room were clean and nice. The rooftop pool was awesome. The location was good, walkable from District 1, and the staff was friendly.   The breakfast buffet was good with decent number of vegetation options.

content.name: Evanri
content.review_content: A good hotel but not 5 star.Very crowded and the lifts very slow.Had to wait for about 10 minutes for lifts .At first we were given small corner rooms with hardly any space to move.only after complaining about the rooms were we given better rooms.Breakfast was good with many choices.But again very crowded.The infinity pool at the rooftop was the best part of the hotel.Overall we had a good stay.

content.name: Craig W
content.review_title: Not 5 star. Pool not available from 6.00 each night due to hiring out to weddings. Lifts were terrible with long waits
content.review_content: Not 5 star. Pool not available from 6.00 each night due to hiring out to weddings. Lifts were terrible with long waits of 15 minutes. Plus they reserve one of them for wedding guests. Pool area not well laid out can probably hold 30 people at most.  Pool is also not heated and no jacuzzi.  Bathroom had mould and fridge didnâ€™t work. Staff canâ€™t speak English so trying to resolve any issue is a waste of time. Find somewhere else with a decent pool and you will get better value for money. Disappointed in our time here given the price

content.name: Jane W
content.review_title: Room and view great, rest average
content.review_content: We had a twin room, very spacious.  At least one lift always unavailable, breakfast very busy by 830am and weddings every night block off the pool from 6pm.  Did not try the food, but didn't like to go too many places in the hotel because the lifts were always packed.

content.name: Jean Francois V
content.review_title: A modern and well located hotel in Ho Chi Minh City
content.review_content: My family spent 5 nights at La Vela Saigon Hotel in December 2022 while I spent only one. However, it was enough to make my mind on the place. La Vela Saigon Hotel is a good option for a stay in Ho Chi Minh City. The room was spacious with a modern decoration and was very clean and well appointed. It had expansive views over the city. The breakfast buffet was also very good with plenty of options. The rooftop pool is fantastic and offers a stunning panorama over the city. However, there was a nagging issue during the whole stay, elevators. We had to spend sometimes close to 10 minutes waiting for an elevator. content.name: Sapna M
content.review_content: Beautiful art in hotel, with disappointing service. The hotel is run down. 1 out of the 4 elevators are not working. You wait forever to get an elevator. I've stayed at incredible hotels around the world and across Vietnam. This was the biggest disappointment. Do not get the corner room, as I literally had to pee sideways to fit. I ordered a mushroom pizza and they used canned mushrooms. Not sure why, when everywhere else in Vietnam had gorgeous variety of fresh mushrooms. Pool area, gorgeous pool but had to wait 45 minutes to get service and they still got it wrong. Then, I had to ask them twice to come pick up my bags, after waiting 25 minutes, I ended up bringing my own luggage downstairs. At 6:30am, they were all just sitting there. No embarrassment that I brought my own

content.name: Stanson H
content.review_title: Spent the new year at La Vela
content.review_content: One of the nicest beds Iâ€™ve slept in. Nice amenities as well. The infinity pool as great but rather crowded due to timing and dates that we were here. Hotel is located at a convenient area within Saigon and walking distance to good food.

content.name: Mark F
content.review_title: Great views - Not worth the money!!
content.review_content: The rooftop pool is lovely and the views are wonderful.   Food is well below what you would expect from a 5 star and certainly not worth the money.  If you donâ€™t mind waiting an hour for an average plate of good then this is for you.   I would suggest staying at another local hotel and getting a pool day pass to see the views.  Rooms are tiny and dated.  Air conditioning is ok.  Overall donâ€™t waste your money here, better spent elsewhere.

content.name: Suneet C
content.review_title: A good hotel, but could be better for a 5*
content.review_content: We stayed from 29 Dec 2022 to 1 Jan 2023.  The good points: - the reception area and floors with rooms were clean and spacious - gym is well equipped - cocktails by the pool are tasty - NYE countdown party was brilliant, with great packages for guests (including a good selection of food and wine) and good entertainment  The areas for improvement (considering this is a 5* hotel): - reception and check in staff could have been more proactive in taking luggage and helping with holdings doors open (if not anything else, they're missing out on an easy opportunity to gain a tip!)  - the pool area is poorly laid out, and the result is that there's very few beds considering the size of the hotel. They're also all fully covered/ shaded so the opportunity to sunbathe is limited when are

content.name: Tran H
content.review_content: I had a date with my friend here. The view is stunning. Highly recommend this place for those people who want a perfect pic. The swimming pool is a plus. Food & beverage has affordable prices. I will definitely come back here next time

content.name: Kary S
content.review_content: BichThuy has been a wonderful support through out the stay. Great place to stay  Lovely hospitality hotel,  Great food  Happy new year 2023  We have visited from India  Itâ€™s a memorable new year party organised   The music show was amazing  We will surely visit again

content.name: Kim
content.review_title: New Year 2023 staycation at La Vela Saigon
content.review_content: My bestfriend and I booked a deluxe corner room for our NYE celebration and we were not disappointed with the view. We had 2 balconies! Had dinner at the Mermaid restaurant, the staff were all nice and accommodating. We had a wonderful time here :)

content.name: Therese F
content.review_content: Stayed here for the new year weekend 2023, for 2 nights. Booked the deluxe corner room, we had two balconies available for HCM views. Pillows were fluffy, bathtub was good for 1 pax. The room controls were interesting. We tried the mermaid restaurant too, unlimited canadian lobster of $60 for dinner is a steal and cooked to your liking. There were also roasted chicken, ham and ribeye in the selection.

content.name: Kai N
content.review_content: Nice place, good hospitality and well mannered employees, requests are promptly complied. Nice bedding, really recommend trying their rooftop pool and bars. If you love poker play at the clubs, both are great. We had a great time, will come back again.

Guys from reservation department were very helpful to help me with my request. Not only that but also receptionist and staff from this hotel can really show their good hospitality.   I was really impressed by the wonderfull swimming pool, you will be in love with that immersive and stunning view.  Haha, that day I visit had great weather with good vibe of staycation asmosphere.  Buffet was good though. Checkin and check out had many guests but they still can process very quick and you dont have to wait so long.  You should pay here a visit some day for a lovely staycation guys.

content.name: John S
content.review_title: Fast check in to a Great Hotel !
content.review_content: Super efficient 5* Hotel Dec 2022 We were met at the airport in Lavela Saigon Hotels staff 2 smart uniformed young men gave us cool drinks and loaded our luggage into the luxury mini van ! We arrived at Lavela Saigon and went straight to check in . No queue 6 staff were on reception! They were fast efficient and very friendly ( some reviewers complained of slow check but we found it super efficient) Welcome drinks were on offer Complimentary) Our 2 rooms were on floor 16 together as requested. Super comfortable emperor size double bed pocket sprung! (U.S.A. Import legit & Platt) walk in rainfall shower great bath. Good air co. Great balcony fantastic river view! Modern well equipped big flatscreen tv. Mini bar coffee machine well appointed room!  The breakfast was a rich buffet

content.name: Tsan M
content.review_content: That was the first time I have been in Vietnam since the pandemic. It has been a rough year so I wanted to enjoy everything I could. I have booked this hotel through a friend recommendation, it made me surprise. The front dest was nice to me, the welcome drink is nothing special but their care and kindness were what stood out to me. While on our way to the room, they gave me an overview, about the meals and hotelâ€™s highlight. When I saw the room, it was beautiful, it smells nice and refreshing. Later, I decided to visit the infinity pool, that the lady has mentioned, since it is noon and the humid is kinda killing me. It was little bit crowded but the view was incredible, and everyone was so friendly. I will definitely stay here again for my future visit.

content.name: Luong G
content.review_content: Nice and clean room , good view from the top , pleasant service from the crew , thanks for the good service. Its the best location in HCMC , should be a place to visit. The rooftop pool is insane. Highly recommend. Me & my friends had so much fun here. We will come back next time

content.name: Nguyen
content.review_title: The Best Dim Sum In Sai Gon
content.review_content: This is the review for Herb & Spices Restaurant  This is the best dim sum I have ever tried, better than those in Singapore restaurants. Really suit my taste as well as my family's one. Their crystal dumplings are perfect with fragrant filling and chewy shell. Xiao long bao is not soupy, but the tasty filling makes me prefer it more. Charsiew is good with juicy meat and not burnt. Chee chong fun is up to standard with lighty sweet soy sauce to pair with. Abalone broccoli is neither oily nor too salty, quite healthy. Fried dumplings are considered good fried dish as per my sis even though we are not fans of fried stuff, and I didn't even have chance to try it since she finished it too fast. Last but not least, their buns are a blast. We tried roated duck and salted egg buns, both
